page.title: 07Closure of a Primary School
page.content: Crosskeys Junior and Infant mixed school is an historic building. It was built in 1880 following the Education Act of 1870. The school was built to cater for some 300 pupils although in 1980 the number was 50. In 1985, the school has a roll of just 34 and is due to close at the end of the summer term 1985. The reasons given by the Welsh Office are "social, economic and environmental". Most of the pupils will transfer to Waunfawr Junior and Infant School. It has 137 pupils and 45 under-5's in the nursery section. This school was built in 1897 and will be taking 19 children following the closure of the Crosskeys school.
